summary: Lakes and rivers in Alaska often serve as key transportation corridors. Many of these waterways and the lands below them—including their beds, banks, and natural resources—are managed by the federal government. But under federal law, a state owns submerged lands beneath waters that were navigable as of the date of statehood—1959 for Alaska. This Q&A describes the processes for resolving ownership of submerged lands and...
title: Alaska Land Management: Resolving Ownership of Submerged Lands
